data.enText: spilled
spilled
spilt
spilt
to flow over the edge of a container by accident; to make liquid do this

data.chText: 桶里的水洒出来了，洒了一地。
data.enText: Water had spilled out of the bucket onto the floor.

data.chText: 她让他吓了一跳，把饮料弄洒了。
data.enText: He startled her and made her spill her drink.

data.chText: 成千上万加仑的原油泄漏，流进了海洋。
data.enText: Thousands of gallons of crude oil were spilled into the ocean.
to come out of a place in large numbers and spread out
The doors opened and people spilled into the street.
Light spilled from the windows.
spill the beans
to tell sb sth that should be kept secret or private
spill (sb's) blood
or
to kill or wound people
spill your guts (to sb)
to tell sb everything you know or feel about sth, because you are upset
cry over spilt milk
cry over spilled milk

data.chText: 枉为无可挽回的事忧伤；作于事无补的担忧
data.enText: to waste time worrying about sth that has happened that you cannot do anything about

data.chText: 常言道：覆水难收，后悔也于事无补。
data.enText: As the saying goes ─ it's no use crying over spilt milk .
spill sth↔out
spill out
to tell sb all about a problem etc. very quickly; to come out quickly

data.chText: 她是不是又向你诉苦了？
data.enText: Has she been spilling out her troubles to you again?
When he started to speak, the words just spilled out.
spill over (into sth)
to fill a container and go over the edge

data.chText: 她往杯子里倒水倒得太满，都溢出来了。
data.enText: She filled the glass so full that the water spilled over.

data.chText: 她突然就控制不住自己的感情了。
data.enText: Her emotions suddenly spilled over.
to start in one area and then affect other areas

data.chText: 骚乱已经波及城市的周边地区。
data.enText: Unrest has spilt over into areas outside the city.
spillage

data.chText: 洒出（量）；泼出（量）；溢出（量）；泄漏（量）
data.enText: an act of letting a liquid come or fall out of a container; the amount of liquid that comes or falls out

data.chText: 许多海鸟死于这次石油泄漏。
data.enText: Many seabirds died as a result of the oil spill.

data.chText: 我把洒在桌上的咖啡擦掉。
data.enText: I wiped up the coffee spills on the table.
a long match, or a thin piece of twisted paper, used for lighting fires, oil lamps, etc.

data.chText: （尤指从自行车或船上）摔下，跌落
data.enText: a fall, especially from a bicycle or a boat
to take a spill
spill the beans
to tell sb sth that should be kept secret or private
spill (sb's) blood
or
to kill or wound people
spill your guts (to sb)
to tell sb everything you know or feel about sth, because you are upset
cry over spilt milk
cry over spilled milk

data.chText: 枉为无可挽回的事忧伤；作于事无补的担忧
data.enText: to waste time worrying about sth that has happened that you cannot do anything about

data.chText: 常言道：覆水难收，后悔也于事无补。
data.enText: As the saying goes ─ it's no use crying over spilt milk .
spill sth↔out
spill out
to tell sb all about a problem etc. very quickly; to come out quickly

data.chText: 她是不是又向你诉苦了？
data.enText: Has she been spilling out her troubles to you again?
When he started to speak, the words just spilled out.
spill over (into sth)
to fill a container and go over the edge

data.chText: 她往杯子里倒水倒得太满，都溢出来了。
data.enText: She filled the glass so full that the water spilled over.

data.chText: 她突然就控制不住自己的感情了。
data.enText: Her emotions suddenly spilled over.
to start in one area and then affect other areas

data.chText: 骚乱已经波及城市的周边地区。
data.enText: Unrest has spilt over into areas outside the city.

tr: a sudden drop from an upright position
example: he had a nasty spill on the ice

tr: the act of allowing a fluid to escape
a channel that carries excess water over or around a dam or other obstruction
reduce the pressure of wind on (a sail)

example: If you don't oblige me, I'll talk!
The former employee spilled all the details

tr: cause or allow (a solid substance) to flow or run out or over
example: spill the beans all over the table

tr: pour out in drops or small quantities or as if in drops or small quantities
example: God shed His grace on Thee

tr: cause or allow (a liquid substance) to run or flow from a container
flow, run or fall out and become lost
example: The milk spilled across the floor
The wine spilled onto the table

value.boxr_value: American English uses the form spilled as the past tense and past participle. British English uses either spilled or spilt. 美国英语中过去式和过去分词为 spilled。英国英语中则既可用 spilled，也可用 spilt。

value.def: If a liquid spills or if you spill it, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container.

example.ex: 70,000 tonnes of oil spilled from the tanker...
example.tran: 7 万吨油从油轮中溢了出来。

example.ex: ...water behind a dam, getting ready to spill over...
example.tran: 大坝里的水随时都会溢出来

example.ex: Don't spill water on your suit.
example.tran: 不要把水洒到你的衣服上。

value.def: A spill is an amount of liquid that has spilled from a container.

example.ex: She wiped a spill of milkshake off the counter...
example.tran: 她把洒出来的奶昔从柜台上擦掉。

example.ex: An oil spill could be devastating for wildlife.
example.tran: 溢出的油对野生动物来说可能是毁灭性的。

value.def: If the contents of a bag, box, or other container spill or are spilled, they come out of the container onto a surface.

example.ex: A number of bags had split and were spilling their contents...
example.tran: 有几只袋子裂开了，里面的东西撒了出来。

example.ex: He carefully balanced the satchel so that its contents would not spill out onto the floor.
example.tran: 他仔细地把小背包放好，不让里面的东西掉到地板上。

value.tran: (使)(袋子、盒子等中盛放的东西)洒出，涌出

value.def: If people or things spill out of a place, they come out of it in large numbers.

example.ex: Tears began to spill out of the boy's  eyes...
example.tran: 男孩的眼泪开始夺眶而出。

example.ex: When the bell rings, more than 1,000 children spill from classrooms.
example.tran: 当铃声响起时，1,000 多名孩子从教室里涌了出来。

value.def: If light spills or is spilled into a place, it shines brightly into it, usually through a gap.

example.ex: She noticed the light spilling under Brian's  door...
example.tran: 她注意到布莱恩门底下透出的光。

example.ex: The door swung open again, spilling light into the cell.
example.tran: 门再次打开了，光照亮了小屋。

value.def: If you spill someone's blood, you kill them or wound them.

example.ex: He is prepared to spill the blood of a million people...
If blood is spilled the countries will be at war.
example.tran: 如果出现伤亡，这些国家就会进入交战状态。

trans: 石油泄漏；（海上）飘油；漏油
外溢；溢出；溢出效应；扩溢；外溢效应
